questions.text: India had signed an Open Skies agreement with which country which will allow designated airlines of both signatory countries to operate freely?
questions.explanation: India finalised an Open Skies Agreement with Japan, allowing designated airlines of both signatory countries to operate freely. This is likely to be formalised during Japanese Prime Minister Shino Abe’s visit to India later this month. The agreement may allow airlines from Japan to fly directly to Chennai and Bengaluru. All Nippon Airways, Japan Airlines and Air India are the only carriers that connect the two countries, now.

questions.text: Pitch Black Exercise is an air exercise between

questions.text: Recently, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated the first ever All India Institute of Ayurveda(AIIA). It is being set at which of the following city?
questions.explanation: Prime Minister has inaugurated the first ever All India Institute of Ayurveda(AIIA) in New Delhi. AIIA has been set up along the line of AIIMS as an apex institute under the Ministry of AYUSH. The institute will bring synergy between traditional wisdom of Ayurveda and modern diagnostic tools and technology.

questions.text: The first woman to conquer Mount Everest twice is
questions.explanation: Santosh Yadav is an Indian mountaineer. She is the first woman in the world to climb Mount Everest twice, and the first woman to successfully climb Mt Everest from Kangshung Face. She first climbed the peak in May 1992 and then did it again in May 1993.

questions.text: Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit 2018 was held in____.
questions.explanation: Shanghai Cooperation Organisation(SCO) summit 2018 was held in the city of Qingdao, China. Shanghai Cooperation Organisation(SCO) summit 2017 was held in Astana, Kazakhstan. India and Pakistan were admitted as full members of the organisation at the Summit in 2017

questions.text: Which bank launched ‘Social Pay’ for NRIs?
questions.explanation: ICICI Bank has launched a cross-border remittance facility that can be used by NRIs for sending money to their friends and family in India through social media like WhatsApp and e-mail. Christened'Social Pay', a sender needs to register on the remittance service application Money2India to transfer money to someone in India.

questions.text: Which of the following section of the Negotiable Instrument Act, 1881 was amended to include the definition of an electronic cheque and that of a truncated cheque?

questions.text: As per the Public Affairs Index(PAI) for 2018, which state has topped in the list of best-governed large states in India?
questions.explanation: According to the Public Affairs Index 2018 released by the think tank Public Affairs Centre(PAC), Kerala stands as the best-governed state in the country among large states followed by Tamil Nadu.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: What do you understand by Marginal Standing Facility?

options.A: Rate of interest which is levied on Short-Term loans taken by commercial banks from RBI.
options.B: Rate at which commercial banks charge on their surplus funds with RBI.
options.C: The amount a commercial bank needs to maintain in the form of cash, or gold or government approved securities (Bonds) before providing credit to its customers.
options.D: It is defined in Sec 49 of RBI Act 1934 as the ‘standard rate at which RBI is prepared to buy or rediscount bills of exchange or other commercial papers eligible for purchase under this act’.
options.E: Marginal standing facility(MSF) is a window for banks to borrow from the Reserve Bank of India in an emergency situation when inter-bank liquidity dries up completely.

questions.explanation: Marginal Standing Facility is a new Liquidity Adjustment Facility(LAF) window created by Reserve Bank of India in its credit policy of May 2011. MSF is the rate at which the banks are able to borrow overnight funds from RBI against the approved government securities.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: Commerce Min approves 15 projects for infrastructure under TIES. TIES is related to which of the following fields?
questions.explanation: Commerce Min approves 15 projects for infrastructure under TIES. TIES is Trade Infrastructure for Export Scheme. Here, TIES is related to export.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: When a group of lenders fund various portions of a loan to a single borrower, it is called___.
questions.explanation: A syndicated loan, also known as a syndicated bank facility, is financing offered by a group of lenders – referred to as a syndicate – who work together to provide funds for a single borrower. The borrower can be a corporation, a large project or sovereignty, such as a government.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: The Ramon Magsaysay Award 2018 winner were Sonam Wangchuk and__.
questions.explanation: The Ramon Magsaysay Award 2018 winner were Sonam Wangchuk and Bharat Vatwani.

questions.text: Which of the following committees has been constituted to suggest laws against mob lynching and violence?
questions.explanation: The Union government has constituted a high-level committee headed by the Union Home Secretary Rajiv Gauba to suggest laws against mob lynching and violence.

questions.text: Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, 2018 will empower authorities to attach and confiscate properties and assets of economic offenders. For which of the following amounts is the term'fugitive offender' applicable in the domestic territory of India?
questions.explanation: Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, 2018 which will empower authorities to attach and confiscate properties and assets of economic offenders like loan defaulters who flee the country. A fugitive offender term applies only to those who owe or more than Rs. 100 crores in the domestic territory of India.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: Who is the author of the book ‘Why I Am a Hindu'?
questions.explanation: Why I Am a Hindu is a 2018 book by Indian politician Shashi Tharoor. In the book, Tharoor writes about the history of Hinduism and its core tenets, as well as socio-cultural developments in India that relate to the religion, while elucidating his own religious convictions.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: A banking outlet which does not provide delivery of service for a minimum of __________ per day and for at least 5 days a week will be considered a'Part-time Banking Outlet'.
questions.explanation: In a bid to take banking services to the remote locations of the country, the Reserve Bank of India has permitted the opening of mini branches or banking outlets across the country for all domestic scheduled commercial banks except Regional Rural Banks without having to take permission from the regulator on a case by case basis. Part-time Banking Outlet- is one which opens for at least five days a week for at least four hours a day. The RBI has clarified that ATM kiosks, cash depositing counters and mobile branches will not be treated as banking outlets.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: Section 22 of Banking Regulations Act, 1949 deals with____.

options.A: Prohibits a banking company from creating a charge upon any unpaid capital of the company
options.B: Contains a system of licensing of banks by the RBI
options.C: Provides that the subscribed capital of a banking company should not be less than one-half of its authorised capital
options.D: to allow Banks to open branches

questions.explanation: Section 22 in BANKING REGULATION ACT,1949.(1) Save as hereinafter provided, no company shall carry on banking business in India unless it holds a licence issued in that behalf by the Reserve Bank and any such licence may be issued subject to such conditions as the Reserve Bank may think fit to impose.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: Payment banks are not allowed to 1) Give loans 2) Issue credit cards 3) Accept Deposit
questions.explanation: Payment banks are allowed to accept demand deposits and issue debit cards and can also distribute non risk sharing financial products like mutual funds and insurance products but prohibited from giving loans and issuing credit cards.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: The Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bansagar canal project in which state?
questions.explanation: \* Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bansagar canal project in Mirzapur in Uttar Pradesh. \* Bansagar Dam project is a joint venture(JV) between Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar Governments. \* It is multipurpose river valley project built on Son River situated in Ganges Basin in Madhya Pradesh.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.text: RBI controls inflation by increasing Repo rate. What is the current Repo Rate at present?
questions.explanation: Repo rate is the rate at which the central bank lends to the commercial banks. Hike in interest rates will lead to a decline in borrowing by the commercial banks and this rise in Repo rate will be effective only when commercial banks increase their base rates. Current Repo Rate is 6.25%

questions.text: Who among the following won the Golden Ball Award?

questions.text: Guru Shikhar, the highest peak in the Aravalli Range at 5650 feet(1722 meters) is located in which state?

questions.text: The book'Our Trees Still Grow In Dehra' is authored by___.
questions.explanation: The book'Our Trees Still Grow In Dehra' is authored by Ruskin Bond. Though It is a collection of short stories by Ruskin Bond each story in very closely interlinked with the other. In this book, Ruskin traces his life from childhood through teenage to adulthood.

questions.text: What is Repo Rate?

options.A: It is a rate at which RBI sell Government securities to banks
options.B: It is a rate at which RBI allows small loans in the market
options.C: It is a rate at which RBI buys Government securities from banks
options.D: It is a rate which is offered by banks to their most valued customers or prime customers

questions.explanation: Repo rate is the rate at which the central bank of a country lends money to commercial banks in the event of any shortfall of funds. Repo rate is used by monetary authorities to control inflation.
questions.subject: General_Awareness
